RT @WillMcAvoyACN: I forgot, @JonahNRO, that the Constitution only applies to people we like.
RT @WillMcAvoyACN: I forgot, @JonahNRO, that the Constitution only applies to people we like.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO Someone weighed in on "acceptability"? I must have missed it, being blinded by your rhetoric-fu.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO That's true, so long as you're only railing against that particular execution, not execution as a practice.
@spongeworthy2 @JonahNRO I don't care if you remember what they did or not. Has nothing to do with the acceptability of the execution.
@charlescwcooke @JonahNRO I think @WillMcAvoyACN makes a strong case and I have chosen now to forget what these monsters actually did.
@JonahNRO @WillMcAvoyACN Also question begging. All round, pretty impressive.
@JonahNRO @WillMcAvoyACN I always turn to the guy running the fake HBO Newsroom account on Constitutional issues.
@JonahNRO @WillMcAvoyACN 2/2 part of the punishment.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO The tortuous part of the execution was not punishment it was an accident. Punishments are purposefully inflicted.
@HNSTHNCBSD @JonahNRO Except, it would seem, Oklahoma's Governor, State House and Supreme Court. Also, Sarah Palin.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO I am fairly certain everyone would agree it is appropriate to take all reasonable steps to avoid torture.
@HNSTHNCBSD @JonahNRO Except they didn't. They sued to find out where the drugs came from, still have not disclosed.
@WillMcAvoyACN Nope. The burden in 8th Amendment cases is on the plaintiff. Farmer v. Brennan, 511 U.S. 825, 832 (1994)
@HNSTHNCBSD Shouldn't the burden of proof be on the state, not the person being executed?
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO No. The 8th amendment bans inflicting cruel and unusual punishment.  t doesn't ban having it occur by accident.
@WillMcAvoyACN Locking someone in a prison where you control the maintenance ect puts you in control of their safety. SCOTUS has found 1/?
@WillMcAvoyACN  I honestly don't have enough knowledge to form an opinion. But even if your right it doesn't justify your attack on Jonah.
@WillMcAvoyACN His argument was not to overreact, not that there was necessarily no legal issue at all. He in fact said 1/2
@HNSTHNCBSD Indeed, he did. What they did or did not do does not matter when the form of execution was inhumane.
@HNSTHNCBSD All day I have been hearing about people who "don't care" about what happened because these people did horrible acts.
@HNSTHNCBSD The court initially ruled a stay and for the state to disclose. Reps threaten impeachment, court reverses judgment.
@HNSTHNCBSD At the very best the state of Oklahoma is extremely corrupt and not interested in due process.
@WillMcAvoyACN That's not going to cut it based on the 8th Amendment precedents.
@HNSTHNCBSD What about negligently doing so by failing to be open and transparent?
@WillMcAvoyACN Intentionally doing so would very probably be considered cruel.
@HNSTHNCBSD I think making someone suffer a 40 minute heart attack could be easily considered cruel.
@WillMcAvoyACN  I don't think that's a plausible reading of the Constitution which explicitly recognizes capital punishment.
@HNSTHNCBSD Not just as humane as possible. If as humane is possible is still inhumane, not acceptable.
@WillMcAvoyACN It does in fact matter. If the execution was "as  humane . . . as possible" it would alleviate your stated concern.
@HNSTHNCBSD That DOES NOT MATTER. No one is making the case that we should be sorry for these people, as @JonahNRO said in his opening.
.@WillMcAvoyACN "What we are saying" Then you'd be a liar, as usual. Unless it was planned it wasn't the intended punishment. @HNSTHNCBSD
@HNSTHNCBSD I'm talking about the specifics in this case.
@WillMcAvoyACN if by "this" you mean the use of this specific drug. Maybe, I dont know enough to say. But if you mean capital punishment 1/2
@WillMcAvoyACN Luckily I'm not a Christian.
.@WillMcAvoyACN "It's the least Christian thing we do" If you aren't Christian this is incredibly despicable&cowardly. So SOP. @HNSTHNCBSD
@HNSTHNCBSD We can debate the merits of the death penalty another day. It's the least Christian thing we do, but whatever. I don't care.
@HNSTHNCBSD What I care about, today, is that the State of Oklahoma violated the Constitution of the United States of America by...
@WillMcAvoyACN What requires such a disclosure? You can be eminently safe without such a disclosure.
@HNSTHNCBSD Did they, after being explicitly asked to, disclose the source of the drug used to execute the criminal?
@HNSTHNCBSD I'm not frustrated with you, so much, as people in general. This issue brings out the worst in people.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO At least as I read Jonah's column it said we should of course strive to be ethical and legal but we shouldn't 1/2
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO It takes a lot of effort.It is a problem which I think we are all aware of. It takes a lot of patience.
@HNSTHNCBSD @JonahNRO Twitter doesn't exactly lend itself to nuanced conversation does it?
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO Again to be clear "the death penalty" means in this specific instance as opposed to in most cases where it is 1/2
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO 2/2 clearly constitutional.
@HNSTHNCBSD @JonahNRO And I read it as downplaying the issues of the death penalty by comparing them to the actions of a horrible human.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO 2/2 go too far and overreact to one incident however horrible it was.
@HNSTHNCBSD For a vast majority of people, this is about vengeance, not justice, and @JonahNRO's column plays right to those people.
@HNSTHNCBSD And I probably should have explicitly stated that from the start, but I didn't.
@WillMcAvoyACN Ok. Sorry you're frustrated. I think the rhetoric is far larger than our disagreement, but whatever.
@HNSTHNCBSD I'm done with this. I've been doing this all fucking day. I'm, quite frankly, exhausted.
@HNSTHNCBSD Even if it didn't violate the Constitution (it did), the civil settlement in this case is going to be harsh.
@WillMcAvoyACN I never set any goalpost . . . its SCOTUS.
@HNSTHNCBSD Keep moving those goalposts.
@WillMcAvoyACN Unless you now believe everything any politician says.
@WillMcAvoyACN The fact that a lawmaker asserts something may be probative but it hardly proves his assertions.
@HNSTHNCBSD http://t.co/9IXdHe7ZH1 How's that for proof?
@WillMcAvoyACN The burden would be quite heavy on you to prove that in court.
@HNSTHNCBSD Did the state not only ignore the initial stay, but put political pressure on judges to reach a specific conclusion?
@WillMcAvoyACN If and only if you can prove that they did not take reasonable steps to avoid this accident and it was foreseeable.
@HNSTHNCBSD ...torturing someone to death.
@WillMcAvoyACN 2/2 then your prior argument doesn't get you anywhere close to there.
@HNSTHNCBSD What we are saying is that this is the kind of punishment explicitly forbidden by the 8th amendment, and we should be better.
@WillMcAvoyACN 2/2 "I think it’s necessary for executions to be as humane and unsensational as possible."
@HNSTHNCBSD I say the Gov & statehouse putting pressure of the State Supreme Court to remove the stay of execution would qualify.
@WillMcAvoyACN that if the plaintiff can prove the prison showed deliberate indifference to the prisoner's safety its an 8th amendment issue
@WillMcAvoyACN But accident's don't cut it.
@WillMcAvoyACN Precisely. You are against death penalty, period. But *using* this to push agenda through deceit. #AnyMeans @HNSTHNCBSD
@HNSTHNCBSD On what planet is that the same as injecting someone with a substance?
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO Being in prison is not unconstitutional because someone could have a horrible slip and fall on the way to his cell.
@HNSTHNCBSD @JonahNRO Furthermore, it doesn't say that you should "try" not to be cruel and unusual, it explicitly bans it.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO If prison took all reasonable steps to avoid cruelty but accident occurs its unfounded to consider the accident 1/2
@WillMcAvoyACN where did I say that we should torture people? You're leaping to a conclusion you assume I hold which I clearly don't.
@WillMcAvoyACN Hi, you deceitful, zealot, piece of garbage, an accident was not the punishment. You're welcome.  @JonahNRO
@kareninatl @JonahNRO I've been making the same case all day, Karen. That the state's actions were not consistent with ensuring Constitution
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO  Appreciate the conv, seriously, but Im going to get off of your circle It will always b 1" further 4 you  Thank u
@kareninatl @JonahNRO No, it wasn't unavoidable, which is why courts in Oklahoma issued a stay until the statehouse threatened impeachment.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO The act of the punishment certainly was justified per judge & jury. Hence unavoidable Result was unfortunate & sad.
@kareninatl @JonahNRO The question isn't was it intentional, it is was it avoidable? And it certainly was.
@kareninatl But if they know those drugs act that way, they should not use them again or it becomes intentional @WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO Incompetent things happen in alot of efforts Doesn't mean intentionally cruel. Was not planned to happen that way.
@WillMcAvoyACN @kareninatl @JonahNRO When it comes to murdering another human being: Intent is irrelevant, competence is essential. Got it.
@kareninatl @JonahNRO The question is not intent, it was competence.
@WillMcAvoyACN @JonahNRO B/C unintentional things happen 2 ppl everyday This guy intended to 2 kill the girl. That's Why.
